title: BJP Accuses Rahul Gandhi Of Pushing Its MP In Parliament Complex Chaos, Considers Police Complaint - News18
summary:
BJP Accuses Rahul Gandhi Of Pushing Its MP In Parliament Complex Chaos

Date: December 19, 2024

Source: News18

In a recent altercation in Parliament, BJP MP Pratap Chandra Sarangi alleged that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi pushed an MP who fell on him, causing minor injuries. The BJP is considering filing a police complaint regarding the incident.

  • The altercation occurred amid a standoff between Congress and BJP over the Ambedkar row.
  • Several BJP MPs confronted Rahul Gandhi regarding the incident, leading to heated exchanges.
  • Pratap Chandra Sarangi was treated for injuries at RML Hospital.
  • The incident has raised questions about parliamentary conduct and privilege.

“Rahul Gandhi pushed an MP who fell on me after which I fell down...” - Pratap Chandra Sarangi

Following the event, serious implications for parliamentary privileges may arise if allegations against Gandhi are proven.
newTitle: BJP Accuses Rahul Gandhi Of Pushing Its MP In Parliament Complex Chaos

title: CAT Result 2024 LIVE Updates: When is result releasing at iimcat.ac.in? - The Indian Express
summary:
CAT Result 2024 LIVE Updates: When is IIMCAT 2024 score card releasing at iimcat.ac.in?

Date: December 2024

Source: Indian Express

The Indian Institute of Management (IIM) Calcutta has now released the final answer keys for the CAT 2024, with results anticipated to be announced shortly. Candidates can access their scorecards on the official website using their registration credentials.

  • 3.29 lakh candidates registered for the CAT exam.
  • Approximately 2.93 lakh candidates appeared for the exam with an attendance rate of 89%.
  • The exam had a total of 1.07 lakh female candidates, 1.86 lakh male candidates, and 5 transgender candidates.
  • Experts believe the CAT 2024 exam was easier than the previous two years, leading to expectations of a higher cut-off.
  • Normalisation processes will be used to determine results, considering various statistical factors.
Candidates with a valid CAT 2024 score will be allowed to register for admission to postgraduate programmes at IIMs and other participating colleges.

This year's CAT results are highly anticipated, and candidates are advised to stay updated on the official site.
newTitle: CAT Result 2024 LIVE Updates: Important Information on Score Card Release

title: Parliament Winter Session Day 20 LIVE: Rahul Gandhi to protest against BR Ambedkar remark by Amit Shah - The Hindu
summary:
Parliament Winter Session LIVE Day 20: Both Houses adjourned amid Opposition protests over Ambedkar remarks

Date: December 19, 2024

Source: The Hindu

The winter session of Parliament faced chaos as both Houses were adjourned shortly after assembly due to protests from opposition parties over Union Home Minister Amit Shah's controversial remarks regarding B.R. Ambedkar.

  • Both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha were adjourned until 2 p.m.
  • Opposition MPs demanded Amit Shah's apology and resignation.
  • Protests continued as the Houses struggled to conduct normal business.
  • Reports indicate heightened tensions between the government and opposition parties over the remarks.
“BJP MPs pushed, prevented me from entering parliament,” said Rahul Gandhi during the protests.

This ongoing turmoil reflects a serious rift in parliamentary proceedings, as opposition parties rally against comments they perceive as an insult to a revered national figure.
newTitle: Parliament Winter Session LIVE Day 20: Both Houses adjourned amid Opposition protests over Ambedkar remarks

GRP on a search for man who boarded ladies coach without clothes - Hindustan Times
summary:
GRP Searches for Man Who Entered Ladies' Coach Naked

Date: December 19, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Government Railway Police (GRP) are on the hunt for a man who boarded a ladies' compartment of a local train in Mumbai without any clothing. This incident caught public attention after a video went viral on social media.

  • The incident occurred on a Kalyan-bound AC local train.
  • CCTV footage captured the man appearing in a shirt and shorts before he disrobed.
  • Passengers reported his behavior leading to his removal from the train at Vikhroli station.
  • The police have filed an FIR under relevant sections of Indian law.
“An FIR was registered under sections 296 and 162 of the Bhartiya Nyaya Sanhita and Indian Railways Act.”

The police continue their search for the unidentified man as this bizarre incident raises concerns about safety in public transport.
newTitle: GRP Searches for Man Who Entered Ladies' Coach Naked

title: 5 terrorists killed in encounter with security forces in J&K's Kulgam - Hindustan Times
summary:
Five Terrorists Killed in Kulgam Encounter with Security Forces

Date: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The encounter in Kulgam district resulted in the death of five terrorists following a security operation. Two personnel were injured during the incident.

  • The gunfight began during a cordon and search operation in the Behibagh area.
  • The terrorists opened fire on security forces, leading to a retaliatory strike.
  • The operation was conducted by the Indian Army and Jammu Kashmir Police based on intelligence of terrorist presence.
“On 19 December 24, based on specific intelligence input regarding presence of terrorists, a Joint Operation launched by Indian Army & Jammu Kashmir Police at Kader, Kulgam. Suspicious activity was observed by vigilant troops and on being challenged, terrorists opened indiscriminate and heavy volume of fire. Own troops effectively retaliated.” - Chinar Corps

The encounter highlights ongoing tensions in Jammu and Kashmir, amidst a series of security operations against terrorist activities.
newTitle: Five Terrorists Killed in Kulgam Encounter with Security Forces

title: Govt blocks 18 OTT platforms for ‘obscene, vulgar, porn content’ says minister L Murugan | Today News - Mint
Amit Shah's remarks show old mentality of BJP, says B.R. Ambedkar's grandson - The Hindu
summary:
Prakash Ambedkar Critiques Amit Shah's Remarks as Reflective of BJP's Old Mentality

Published on: December 19, 2024

Source: The Hindu

On December 19, 2024, Prakash Ambedkar, grandson of B.R. Ambedkar, asserted that Union Home Minister Amit Shah's comments regarding the father of the Constitution showed the BJP's outdated mindset. His remarks prompted protests from the INDIA bloc in Parliament.

  • Ambedkar accused Shah of disrespecting B.R. Ambedkar.
  • He emphasized that the BJP's previous incarnations had opposed Ambedkar during the Constitution's adoption.
  • Congress members also called for Shah to apologize publicly.
  • Ambedkar demanded compensation for the family of Somnath Suryawanshi who died in judicial custody during related protests.
  • He warned that the passage of new election bills could threaten the future of political parties.
"HM @AmitShah, in case you didn't know - Babasaheb Dr. Bhimrao Ambedkar is equivalent to God and the Constitution he drafted is a Holy Book for crores of people across the world. How dare you speak about Dr. Ambedkar with such disdain?" — K C Venugopal

Ambedkar's statements reflect ongoing tensions regarding the political portrayal of Dr. B.R. Ambedkar in contemporary discourse.
newTitle: Prakash Ambedkar Critiques Amit Shah's Remarks as Reflective of BJP's Old Mentality

title: J&K: 'Mystery' illness grips Rajouri village, toll at 8 as Govt calls in experts - Hindustan Times
summary:
Mystery Illness Claims 8 Lives in Rajouri Village, J&K Government Calls in Experts

Publication Date: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A mysterious illness has struck Badhaal village in Rajouri district, Jammu and Kashmir, resulting in eight fatalities, mostly children. Authorities have deployed a central team of experts and a mobile laboratory to investigate the cause of the illness.

  • The death toll has risen to eight, with victims primarily from two families in Badhaal village.
  • A mobile laboratory (BSL-3) has been sent to expedite testing of the illness.
  • The latest victim was a 12-year-old boy who succumbed after being hospitalized for six days.
  • Past cases include the deaths of two of his younger siblings.
"In response to the incident, a Biosafety Level 3 (BSL-3) mobile laboratory has been sent to Rajouri," said a government spokesperson.

This incident highlights the urgency of identifying the illness to prevent further cases, ensuring community safety and health.
newTitle: Mystery Illness Claims 8 Lives in Rajouri Village, J&K Government Calls in Experts

Delhi wakes up to fog, nearly severe-plus AQI; cold wave in parts of Karnataka | Weather updates - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi wakes up to fog, nearly severe-plus AQI; cold wave in parts of Karnataka

Date: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

On December 19, 2024, Delhi reported a dangerously high Air Quality Index (AQI) of 448, nearing the severe-plus category, as cold weather and dense fog enveloped the region.

  • AQI Levels: The overall AQI in various parts of Delhi is classified as 'very poor' to 'severe-plus' with 21 monitoring stations recording alarming levels.
  • Cold Wave Conditions: Cold wave effects are being felt across large parts of northern India, including Himachal Pradesh and Jammu & Kashmir, where temperatures dropped below freezing.
"Delhi's AQI remains critically high, with many localities suffering from extreme pollution levels."

The effects of both severe air pollution and cold weather are impacting daily life in the region, requiring urgent attention.
newTitle: Delhi Faces Severe Air Quality and Cold Wave Conditions

title: BR Ambedkar's grandson takes aim at Amit Shah on remarks: ‘Same old mentality’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
BR Ambedkar's grandson takes aim at Amit Shah on remarks: ‘Same old mentality’

Date: Dec 19, 2024
Source: HT News

Prakash Ambedkar, the grandson of Dr. BR Ambedkar, criticized Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks regarding Dr. Ambedkar, suggesting they highlight the BJP's outdated mentality.

  • Prakash Ambedkar claimed that the BJP’s inability to achieve its goals is due to Dr. Ambedkar's influence.
  • He stated Shah’s comments reflect a deep-rooted mentality within the BJP and accused them of not being able to implement their agenda due to opposition from Dr. Ambedkar's ideals.
  • Several opposition MPs protested in Parliament against Shah’s remarks, calling them an insult to Dr. Ambedkar.
  • Amit Shah suggested that the frequent mention of Ambedkar has become fashionable among opponents, implying a diminished respect for him.
"There is nothing new in the statement. They are not able to execute their old plans. Not because of Congress, but because of Babasaheb Ambedkar."

In conclusion, Prakash Ambedkar's comments not only criticize Shah's remarks but also express concern over political trends and their implications on democracy and governance.
newTitle: BR Ambedkar's Grandson Critiques Amit Shah Over Controversial Remarks

title: Trump threatens India with reciprocal tariffs - The Tribune India
summary:
Trump Threatens India with Reciprocal Tariffs

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Tribune

US President-elect Donald Trump has reiterated his intention to impose reciprocal tariffs if India continues to impose high tariffs on imports of certain American products.

This article highlights Trump's stance on international trade and tariffs, particularly focusing on his remarks regarding India, Brazil, and China.

  • Trump emphasizes the importance of reciprocal tariffs.
  • India, Brazil, and China are singled out for high tariffs on US products.
  • He mentions the fairness in imposing equal tariffs.
  • A trade agreement with China is also mentioned in relation to tariffs.
“The word reciprocal is important... if India charges us 100 per cent, do we charge them nothing for the same?” - Donald Trump

Trump’s comments suggest an evolving stance on trade negotiations that may impact future relations between the US and these countries.
newTitle: Trump Threatens India with Reciprocal Tariffs

title: Farmers can directly come to us with demands: Supreme Court - The Tribune India
'Entitled to relief': Vijay Mallya reacts to FM Nirmala Sitharaman's statement on Rs 14,131 crore debt re - The Times of India
summary:
‘Entitled to relief’: Vijay Mallya reacts to FM Nirmala Sitharaman's statement on Rs 14,131 crore debt recovery

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Vijay Mallya has expressed his view regarding the statement made by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman concerning the recovery of Rs 14,131 crore in debts. He claims he is entitled to relief and disputes claims against him.

  • Mallya addressed the statements made by FM Sitharaman about the debt recovery efforts.
  • He asserts that he deserves relief from the ongoing financial claims against him.
  • The controversy stems from his alleged financial irregularities during his tenure as the head of Kingfisher Airlines.
“I am entitled to relief as a matter of law,” said Mallya in a recent statement.

This ongoing situation involving Mallya remains a point of contention in the public domain, as discussions about debt recovery and accountability continue.
newTitle: Vijay Mallya Responds to FM Nirmala Sitharaman on Debt Recovery

title: CJI Khanna briefs full court of SC on Collegium meeting with Justice Yadav - The Indian Express
summary:
CJI Khanna Briefs Supreme Court on Collegium Meeting Concerning Justice Yadav

Date: Wednesday, Source: The Indian Express

Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna briefed the full court about the Collegium's meeting with Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav following his controversial remarks about Muslims.

  • The meeting focused on allegations against Justice Yadav after his remarks at a Vishwa Hindu Parishad event prompted demands for impeachment.
  • No decisions have been made regarding Justice Yadav's future as the Collegium is awaiting further deliberation.
  • Options for Justice Yadav include a public apology or potentially an in-house inquiry.
  • Justice Yadav's statements included controversial views on the Uniform Civil Code and his remarks suggested a preference for Hindu values over Islamic ones.
“I have no hesitation in saying that this is Hindustan… and the country will run according to the majority who live in Hindustan.” - Justice Yadav

The Collegium's handling of this situation reflects its seriousness about maintaining judicial integrity amidst growing tensions in the public discourse.
newTitle: CJI Khanna Briefs Supreme Court on Collegium Meeting Concerning Justice Yadav

summary:
Priyanka Gandhi, Supriya Sule, Anurag Thakur among 31 in ONOE JPC

Publication Date: Unknown | Source: Unknown

This article discusses the inclusion of prominent political figures like Priyanka Gandhi, Supriya Sule, and Anurag Thakur in the newly formed ONOE Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC).

  • 31 members appointed to the ONOE JPC.
  • Notable political figures included in the committee.

The appointment of such influential members to the JPC is expected to impact legislative processes significantly.

title: Mallya takes jibe at Finance Minister over claim of ₹14,000 crore debt recovery - The Hindu
summary:
Mallya Challenges Finance Minister on Debt Recovery Claims

Published: December 19, 2024 02:10 am IST | Source: The Hindu

Vijay Mallya has publicly confronted Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman regarding her claims of asset recovery, highlighting a significant discrepancy between announced recovery amounts and the adjudicated debts.

  • Mallya disputes the Finance Minister's statement that ₹14,131.6 crore has been recovered from him.
  • He asserts that this recovery amount exceeds the debt adjudicated by courts, which was ₹6203 crore.
  • The controversy arises from the government's ongoing efforts to combat financial crime as Mallya remains a fugitive from justice.
  • The Finance Minister noted significant recoveries from other figures involved in financial misconduct, including Nirav Modi and Mehul Choksi.
“The FM announced in Parliament that through the ED, Banks have recovered ₹14,131.60 crore from me against the judgement debt of ₹6203 crore and I am still an economic offender.” - Vijay Mallya

This confrontation raises questions about the legal justification of asset recovery and its implications for Mallya's status as an economic offender.
newTitle: Mallya Challenges Finance Minister on Debt Recovery Claims

title: Foreigners’ entry restricted in Manipur, Mizoram, Nagaland - The Hindu
summary:
Foreigners’ Entry Restricted in Manipur, Mizoram, Nagaland

Published: December 19, 2024 - Source: The Hindu

The Union Home Ministry has reimposed the Protected Area Regime (PAR) in Manipur, Nagaland, and Mizoram due to security concerns regarding the influx of foreigners from neighboring countries.

  • Foreigners now require prior permission and special permits to visit these states.
  • The relaxation of the PAR, previously in effect for 14 years, has been revoked.
  • The Ministry emphasized that visits to protected areas should only occur for extraordinary reasons.
  • The new directive was issued to the Chief Secretaries of the respective states.
  • Over 250 people have died, and more than 60,000 have been displaced due to recent ethnic violence in Manipur.
“The people of Manipur are urged to exercise caution and not to pay heed to statements or claims from organisations of dubious origins.”

The reimposition of the Protected Area Regime underlines the focus on closely monitoring foreign movements in these northeastern states amidst ongoing tensions.
newTitle: Foreigners’ Entry Restricted in Manipur, Mizoram, Nagaland

Congress, leaders receive notice from X over sharing video clips of Amit Shah’s Rajya Sabha speech - The Hindu
summary:
Congress Receives Notice from X for Sharing Amit Shah's Speech Clips

Published on: December 19, 2024

Source: The Hindu

The Congress party and some leaders were notified by social media platform X regarding the sharing of certain video clips of Union Home Minister Amit Shah, referencing a speech discussing B.R. Ambedkar and addressing the opposition.

  • On December 18, 2024, Congress leaders received notices from X.
  • The notices refer to a request from the Cyber Crime Coordination Centre of the MHA to remove the videos.
  • X expressed its commitment to free speech while addressing the issue.
  • Amit Shah held a press conference to defend his comments and allegations against Congress.
Amit Shah alleged that Congress is twisting facts and is anti-Ambedkar and anti-reservation.

This notice reflects ongoing tensions between the Congress party and the ruling government, highlighting the complexities of free speech and political discourse in India.
newTitle: Congress Receives Notice from X for Sharing Amit Shah's Speech Clips

Man Rapes 10-Year-Old Girl, Inserts Rod In Her Genitals: Gujarat Police - NDTV
summary:
Man Arrested for Raping and Injuring 10-Year-Old Girl in Gujarat: Police

Date & Source: NDTV, December 18, 2024

Introduction: A 10-year-old girl was kidnapped and raped by a 36-year-old man in Gujarat's Bharuch. The accused, identified as Vijay Paswan, was arrested by the police.

  • The incident took place in the Jhagadia industrial area of Bharuch on Monday.
  • The accused lived next to the girl's hut and worked in the same factory as her father.
  • The girl sustained injuries to her private parts and was taken to a civil hospital in Bharuch but her condition worsened due to an injury in the waist and she had to be immediately operated on.
  • The survivor was referred to a government hospital in Vadodara.
  • The accused raped the girl and inserted an iron rod in her private parts.
  • The police found that the accused had raped the girl last month as well.
Superintendent of Police, Mayur Chawda, said, the man, Vijay Paswan, raped her and inserted an iron rod in her private parts, adding that during their preliminary investigation, they found that the accused raped the girl last month as well.

Conclusion: The police have filed charges under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act. The incident highlights the urgency of addressing sexual violence against children and the need for stringent measures to protect them.
newTitle: Man Arrested for Raping and Injuring 10-Year-Old Girl in Gujarat: Police

summary:
Nude Man on AC Train Possibly Mentally Ill?

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Not provided

A disturbing incident involving a nude man on an AC train sparked conversations about mental health awareness and public safety.

  • A nude man was spotted on an AC train, raising concerns regarding his mental state.
  • The incident highlights ongoing issues related to mental health in public spaces.
  • Authorities are being urged to address mental health support more effectively.
"This incident underscores the urgent need for better mental health resources in our communities."

title: Centre blocks 18 OTT platforms under IT rules over ‘obscene, vulgar’ content - Hindustan Times
summary:
Centre blocks 18 OTT platforms under IT rules over 'obscene, vulgar' content

Date: Dec 18, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Indian government has blocked 18 OTT platforms for publishing obscene and vulgar content, as stated by Minister of State for Information and Broadcasting, L Murugan, in a recent Lok Sabha session.

  • The blocking is under the IT Rules of 2021, which impose due diligence obligations on intermediaries.
  • The blocked platforms were informed on March 14, 2024, for their content violations.
  • The Rules include a Code of Ethics for digital media publishers.
  • The government can block content regarding national security, public order, and integrity of India.
"The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting has taken action in coordination with various intermediaries, and blocked 18 OTT platforms for publishing obscene, vulgar, and, in some instances, pornographic content." - L. Murugan

This decision reflects the government's strict stance on maintaining content standards in digital media to align with societal values and legal frameworks.
newTitle: Centre blocks 18 OTT platforms under IT rules over 'obscene, vulgar' content

title: Influencer Throws Notes On Highway For 'Money Hunt' Challenge, Arrested In Hyderabad - NDTV
summary:
Influencer Arrests for Money Hunt Challenge in Hyderabad

Publication Date: December 18, 2024 | Source: NDTV

An Instagram influencer has been arrested in Hyderabad after a video he posted showing him throwing bundles of currency notes along the Outer Ring Road (ORR) went viral, leading to public chaos and safety concerns.

  • The individual, known as Bhanuchander alias Anchor Chandu, initiated a 'Money Hunt' challenge.
  • In the video, he claimed to have tossed ₹20,000 in cash near ORR exit number 9, causing people to stop their cars and search for the money.
  • The act led to traffic disruption and prompted police action for public safety.
  • Authorities have registered a case against him for endangering public safety.
“Social media should be a platform to inspire and educate, not to act irresponsibly,” said Rachakonda Police Commissioner G. Sudheer Babu.

The incident highlights the potential dangers of irresponsible social media challenges and the need for responsible content creation.
newTitle: Influencer Arrested for Dangerous 'Money Hunt' Challenge in Hyderabad

title: China says Doval & Wang Yi reached '6 points of consensus' for 'acceptable package', India mum - ThePrint
summary:
China Claims Consensus with India on Border Issues, India Remains Noncommittal

Publication Date: October 25, 2023
Source: The Print

China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi and India's National Security Advisor Ajit Doval met and reportedly reached six points of agreement regarding the ongoing border disputes, although India's official statement did not confirm this consensus.

  • China asserts that a consensus was reached on border issues.
  • India's Ministry of External Affairs did not acknowledge the Chinese claims.
  • Both sides emphasized the importance of managing border issues within the broader context of bilateral relations.
  • The meeting was the first between the special representatives in five years.
  • Discussions included enhancing communication and cooperation on cross-border issues.
“Both sides reaffirmed their commitment to continuing to seek a fair, reasonable, and mutually acceptable package solution to the border issue.” - Chinese Foreign Ministry

This meeting marks a significant moment in China-India relations, indicating a willingness to engage diplomatically while navigating complex territorial disputes.
newTitle: China Claims Consensus with India on Border Issues, India Remains Noncommittal
